results.title: A Pornographic affair = Une Liaison pornographique [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Frederic Fonteyne, Claude Waringo, Rolf Schmid, Patrick Quinet, Canal+, Radio Television Belge Francophone (RTBF), Fama Film, ARP, Le Production Lazemec, Samsa Film and Artemis Productions
results.brief_description: Two strangers, played by Nathalie Baye and Sergi Lopez, meet through a personal ad in a pornographic magazine. They are both interested in exploring a sexual fantasy that for a variety of reasons they feel shy of disclosing with regular partners. Filmed in flashback, while the two characters are interviewed straight to the camera, this erotic and intelligent film explores how men and women are navigating the fraught arena of sexual desire in a post-feminist and post-macho culture. Both Baye and Lopez deliver charming and realistic performances in which they present the ambiguities and contradictions of modern urban life: on one hand proud and happy with their independence; on the other aching for the comfort and solidity of dependency. In the end, the sexual fantasy which begins this pornographic affair, does not matter: it is up to the viewer to interpret the relationship through the nature of our own desires and fantasies. Beyond sex, desire and fantasy, “A Pornographic Affair” argues that what matters is our ability to communicate and to be open to being touched by another human being. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: A Point of return
results.creator_credit: Carl Stevenson and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Presents the problem of suicide as discussed by doctors, psychiatrists, and social workers. Uses a case history to point out that the causes and related aspects of suicide are not always understood. Includes an introduction by Dr Karl Menninger.

results.title: A Poem by Edward Lear: The Owl and the pussy-cat
results.creator_credit: John Korty, McGraw-Hill Films and Contemporary Films
results.brief_description: Uses animation to portray the children’s poem ‘The Owl and the Pussy-cat’, by Edward Lear, in which the owl and the pussycat jump into their pea-green boat and sail out to the sea. Narrated by Cyril Ritchard. Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: A Pocketful of history
results.creator_credit: Doug Tainsh, Ian Jones, Bank of New South Wales and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description: The history of Australia is reflected in its various changes of currency. The story is told ful1 circle, from the first decimal coins, Spanish dollars, used in early Sydney, through the beginning of the Bank of New South Wales, the Gold Rush, Federation, Depression, two World Wars and finally the Decimal Currency Commission of 1959. Highlights include Ned Kelly’s daring robberies; opening of the first Parliament in 1910. Narrated by Roland Strong.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Doug Tainsh, Ian Jones, Bank of New South Wales and Crawford Productions

results.title: A Plea for the wanderer
results.creator_credit: Jean Coutu, Jean-Marc Garand and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: From river to sea, and back to river again, this film follows the arduous life cycles of east and west coast salmon, revealing both the perils of nature and the threats posed by man. Vivid close-ups capture exciting moments when the salmon hatch, jump rapids, and perform their intricate spawning ritual. Other footage examines the Canadian government’s programs to protect the salmon runs. The film makes it clear that the continuation of indiscriminate high-seas salmon fishing could prove fatal to one of the world’s most important food and industrial resources.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean Coutu, Jean-Marc Garand and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A Planter of colonial Virginia (1740-1765)
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: Produced in collaboration with the Williamsburg Restoration, this film aims at an authentic portrayal of life in 18th century colonial Virginia. Williamsburg was the centre of the economic, social and political life of the colony, which depended mainly on the products of the tobacco plantations in the area for its wealth. The life of the slaves and indentured servants is studied, in conjunction with the current legal system, together with the social customs of the plantation owners and their families, and the music, architecture, and costumes of the period. The methods of manufacture, means of transport, and the medical practices of the day are also presented.

results.title: A Plan to be safe
results.brief_description: Carla Zekas and her family were spending a hot Summer’s day by the river when the dark clouds first emerged. At that moment, the plan changed from staying cool to being safe.
